segment.source: Manage access to private store (Windows 10)
segment.target: Manage access to private store (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can manage access to your private store in Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: You can manage access to your private store in Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Manage access to private store
segment.target: Manage access to private store

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: You can manage access to your private store in Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: You can manage access to your private store in Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Organizations might want control the set of apps that are available to their employees, and not show the full set of applications that are in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Organizations might want control the set of apps that are available to their employees, and not show the full set of applications that are in the Windows Store.

segment.source: Using the private store with the Store for Business, an administrator can curate the set of apps that are available to their employees.
segment.target: Using the private store with the Store for Business, an administrator can curate the set of apps that are available to their employees.

segment.source: The private store is a feature in Store for Business that organizations receive during the sign up process.
segment.target: The private store is a feature in Store for Business that organizations receive during the sign up process.

segment.source: When admins add apps to the private store, all employees in the organization can view and download the apps.
segment.target: When admins add apps to the private store, all employees in the organization can view and download the apps.

segment.source: Your private store is available as a tab in the Windows Store, and is usually named for your company or organization.
segment.target: Your private store is available as a tab in the Windows Store, and is usually named for your company or organization.

segment.source: Only apps with online licenses can be added to the private store.
segment.target: Only apps with online licenses can be added to the private store.

segment.source: Your private store looks something like this:
segment.target: Your private store looks something like this:

segment.source: Organizations using an MDM to manage apps can use a policy to show only the private store.
segment.target: Organizations using an MDM to manage apps can use a policy to show only the private store.

segment.source: When your MDM supports the Store for Business, the MDM can use the Policy CSP.
segment.target: When your MDM supports the Store for Business, the MDM can use the Policy CSP.

segment.source: More specifically, the ApplicationManagement/RequirePrivateStoreOnly policy.
segment.target: More specifically, the ApplicationManagement/RequirePrivateStoreOnly policy.

segment.source: You can also prevent employees from using the Windows Store.
segment.target: You can also prevent employees from using the Windows Store.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure access to Windows Store.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure access to Windows Store.

segment.target: Related topics
